text: hello fellow travelers mark here with

Town Hall the beautiful Town Hall here
in Vienna Austria I'm actually teaching
here this summer and I went to school
here when I was in college and it kind
of reminded me of all the great stuff
about living abroad and some of the not
stuff that aren't so good about living
abroad so that's why today we have for
you are the five things you're going to
love and hate about living abroad
whether it's studying working whatever
so let's get started you know I like the
bad news first and even when you live
abroad there are some bad things the
first thing you're not going to like is
the fact that you are far away from your
family and friends and so you do get
homesick you do miss some of those
special family occurrences things like
that I mean I lived in Berlin when my
grandmother passed away and she was very
ill I didn't get a chance to go see her
before she died
it was really tough and you know when it
comes to Halloween and Thanksgiving
times you know Halloween's kind of
celebrate lots of places but
Thanksgiving isn't really celebrated
except for in the u.s. so end of
November I get kind of homesick missing
you know turkey and pumpkin pie and
Thanksgiving Day specials and football
and all these things and that's kind of
one of the things you're really not
going to like about living abroad is you
do get homesick and you do miss your
family and friends because you are so
far away from them now to get past that
what's really great is now we have all
these technology stuff so you can Skype
them video call them have those things
also you can plan for trips to be with
your family and they can come see you or
you go see them so it's pretty cool like
that okay the second thing you're not
going to like about living abroad is
making local friends not that you don't
want to make local friends because
they're the best thing my buddy Alvey I
loved him and Pedro and Portugal and all
kinds of stuff but guys meeting friends
abroad is very tough because usually if
your next path they expect you to hang
out with other expats because those are
the easy people to meet making local
friends takes time and energy and it is
tough and that's one thing is going to
suck is for you to find out all the cool
things that your country has to offer or
where you're living you need to know the
locals and making those first local
friends are really tough but once you
make them the door is open up for really
great experience the third thing you're
not going to like about living abroad
are the cultural differences that you
don't really know about like I know
Austrians are more reserved
but the thing is I don't know like how
do I deal with the bureaucracy how do I
pay my taxes where do I go to pay the
cable how do I even get cable these kind
of things like this that you're used to
getting at home but they're checking on
the website or calling up and these
things you're used to but here they're
all different you know you know you try
to find a doctor or you try to figure
out which post office you're supposed to
pick up your packages in these
differences can be quite frustrating
also the cultural difference is you know
some places where you must I mean in
Germany I'm always here a doctor I'll
pull Fetisov Voltas no no you can call
me mark yes dr. professor Voltas like no
I want to be more friendly now it's a
very professional atmosphere so figuring
out these cultural differences really
can be a problem so to get over those
cultural differences really you need to
do your research before you come there's
these culture shock books that are
really good read up beforehand we try to
help you out with some of those things
but figure out some of those cultural
differences beforehand so you can be
ready for it you know in Portugal
realize that they say dinner's at 8:00
it means is at 9:00 or 9:30 so don't
show up until 10:00 okay but if you
don't know that you get really
frustrated so just be prepared for those
cultural misunderstandings and you'll be
okay but realize there are differences
out there the fourth thing you're not
going to like about living abroad is
when you get sick because the problem is
is when you're home you can explain to
someone yeah it's like my liver is on
fire well how do you translate that to
the Chinese if you don't speak Chinese I
mean the getting sick of Rod sucks
because even if it's just getting
medicine I know I want Advil but oh it's
ibuprofen well what's ibuprofen in
Portuguese you know trying to figure
these things out also in some countries
you don't need a prescription other
places you do so you need to realize it
that's what's really going to start
getting sick and for example some of the
regulations I taught in Portugal I
didn't get another tetanus shot and more
of vaccines to teach at a university
there then I even had you to go to
school in the US so it does get kind of
annoying now the fifth thing you're not
going to like about living abroad is the
move whether it's to move to Europe or
South America or the move back home
figuring out what you're going to take
how you're going to take it abroad
what's worth taking what's not worth
taking all those things does make a pain
in the butt also if you're moving for
work who's paying for the move how are
we going to where the kids going to go
to school
spouse going to get a job these kind of
things really put a lot of pressure on
when you move abroad and it can be kind
of tough so it is really bad and then
when you move back from abroad you want
to make sure they still have a job for
you when you go home or a place to live
or find a place to live when you're
going someplace it can be extremely
frustrating and may turn you off from
living abroad even before you go okay
but those are five basically really
honestly little things about not liking
living abroad because I love living
abroad I've lived in China Brazil the US
Germany Portugal I mean you guys have
seen my videos I go all over the place
and I live all over the place because it
is fantastic so what are the five things
you're going to love about living abroad
and the one thing the best thing about
it all is the experience you get and
that's you're gonna love the experience
of actually living abroad getting to see
new cultures meeting new people going
all over the place
there's so many fantastic experiences
you get and it really opens your opens
your eyes opens your mind and opens your
heart to the world and that's what's a
fantastic about living abroad is the all
the whole experience and how it changes
you and gives you a more worldly
perspective on life and how things work
and guys it goes everything changes from
the foods you eat to the stuff in your
house to how you decorate to how you
watch the news will really change just
by living abroad that experience is a
life changing experience
the second thing going to love about
living abroad are the friends you make
because since you're living this new
country you really attached on to the
friends you do make and my buddy Albie
from Lithuania we still meet each other
every year my buddy Magnus we met in
Germany I'm going to see him next week
in Malta I'm going to go meet some of my
Czech friends in Prague you know is this
weekend I mean it's just it's fantastic
because you make these great friends all
over they help you learn about their
culture you learn about their culture
and you make lifelong friends that you
go see we go back to Vicenza Italy
almost every year to see Fernando and
Elena our two best buddies in Italy
because we can't became such good
friends I was living in Brazil we met
each other there and you really make
friends for life when you are living
abroad and it really it really makes it
a fantastic experience the people you do
meet the third thing you're going to
love about living abroad are the
opportunities to travel now I'm working
in Vienna right now so this weekend
we're going to I'm going to Prague
next week I'm flying down to Malta
you know what maybe this afternoon I'll
head over to Bratislava when you live
abroad you have an opportunity to travel
and you should definitely take it don't
just sit at home watching TV
find a local festival find the local
theatre thing going on and go experience
the culture and take the travel
opportunities that are there for you
while you are abroad because you never
know that might be the only time you get
six months to live in Austria or three
months free to go to Greece because
otherwise you might be sitting at work
for the next 20 years and all you get is
two weeks off vacation so take that
chance while you live abroad to go see
and explore as much as you can the
fourth thing about living abroad that I
think it's kind of cool is actually
though you miss your family it can bring
you closer to your family I know my
family lived with me here so my wife and
my kids and I we really got really close
living here together experiencing all
this together more family experience
things but when I was single when my
parents would come visit me it was great
because we were together for 24 hours a
day seven days a week which can be a
little bit stressful but think about it
now I'm actually spending time with them
exploring with them trying new drinks
new foods and having these great
experiences with my family and that
brings us closer together as a family
also now with Skype and FaceTime and all
this stuff I actually talked to my
parents more when I'm abroad than when I
lived three hours away for them because
we'll Skype every day to say hi
whereas when I'm in the US and I'm
living there well maybe I'll go see them
once a month and I might call once a
month and if I go see them I only see
them for like five hours now you really
get to see your family and be with them
and you really start to appreciate them
a lot more that's one things that is
really an offshoot of all my travels I
have a much better relationship with my
family from my parents my aunt and uncle
that travelled with me to my kids and my
wife and the fifth thing you love about
living abroad is when you go back you
get to be that guy oh that's the dude
that lived in Europe that's the dude
that backpack through Pakistan that's
the guy you become that person because
you have all these stories and all these
experiences you can share with people
and it makes you more fun I mean I'll be
honest with you is more fun to talk to
people nobody wants to talk to me about
being a professor people want to talk to
me about travels
and living abroad gives you these
experiences to share and that's what's
great and also your resume looks a lot
better when you go talk to companies
anyway those the five things I love and
hate about living abroad we also have
